results.title: Muscle
results.creator_credit: Andreas Poulsson, ONF | NFB and Barry Lank
results.brief_description: Pat Feras, who is a social worker by profession, spends most of her leisure hours body building. This film shows Pat training for, and competing in, a women’s body building championship and includes fascinating footage, of the championship, both from backstage and upfront.

results.title: Murrayville Consolidated School
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and E.J. Perry
results.brief_description: Documentary about a co-educational school in Murrayville, Victoria which began as a single room class in 1914 to a consolidated school by 1946. Children from about a dozen areas including Manya North, Kadoon, Gunamalary, Ngallo Sunset etc were picked up by bus from their rural homes.

results.title: Murray River trip per 'Marion' July 1940
results.brief_description: Home movie of trip taken along the Murray River in July 1940 showing picturesque sights along the journey including the almond blossoms and oranges at Berri, South Australia; the junction of the Murray and Darling Rivers near Wentworth; the many lochs between Mildura to Morgan; paddle-steamers and a sunset on the Murray.

results.title: Murphy's law
results.brief_description: Recommends thinking pre-planning and organisation as the ways in which to break Murphy’s Law - “If anything can go wrong, it will”. Sponsored by insurance companies to encourage development of emergency plans etc.

results.title: Murder on the dance floor (July 2006)
results.brief_description: A blood chilling murder mystery set at a high school formal. This green screen workshop was produced as part of the G.A.T.E.ways (gifted and talented education) program for kids. The year 6 students learnt scripting, production and performance skills using virtual set technology.

results.title: Murder in purdah (D)
results.brief_description: Presented as part of ABC TV’s ‘Foreign correspondent’ in May 1999, this British documentary looks at the devastating, and by Western standards unequitable restrictions that Islam and Pakistani society tradition places on women. It is a tradition that allows beating, burnings, murder and other atrocities to be perpetuated against women. There is also the strong possibility that these activities will continue, with strict Sharia law gaining political favour. ‘Murder in purdah’ is a testament to the desperation of the women affected by a climate of injustice based on patriarchal and religious tradition. Reporter: Olenka Frenkiel

results.title: Murder by neglect
results.brief_description: Portrays living conditions in Western Sicily - of poverty and ignorance and unemployment in some villages and the attempts made by social workers in another village to improve conditions. The question is asked, “Must unemployment be allowed to force them into crime?” If we see these things and do nothing about them, we are guilty of murder by neglect.
